required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Dexterity in Prevalent Peritoneal Dialysis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Manual Dexterity in a Monocentric Cohort of Peritoneal Dialysis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to measure the manual dexterity of patients treated by peritoneal dialysis - transversal study

detailed_description.textblock: All peritoneal dialysis patients from Peritoneal Dialysis unit will, after information and consent, have to realise four tests, one time each, to quantify their manual dexterity. The tests are already used to measure dexterity: Purdue Pegboard, Jebsen test, JAMAR, Pinch test. These tests will be performed during an in-hospital visit.

primary_outcome.measure: success of dexterity measurement in peritoneal dialysis patients evaluated by the Purdue Pegboard
primary_outcome.description: number of completed tests (Purdue Pegboard - number inserted in 30 second)

primary_outcome.measure: success of dexterity measurement in peritoneal dialysis patients evaluated by the Jebsen test
primary_outcome.description: number of completed tests (Jebsen test - time in second)

primary_outcome.measure: success of dexterity measurement in peritoneal dialysis patients evaluated by the JAMAR
primary_outcome.description: number of completed tests (JAMAR - in kilogramms)

primary_outcome.measure: success of dexterity measurement in peritoneal dialysis patients evaluated by the Pinch test
primary_outcome.description: number of completed tests (Pinch testin - kilogramms)

study_pop.textblock: All prevalent PD patients from our center will be included

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients treated by peritoneal dialysis in Caen University Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal to participate
